column4: why do you say that, this is not true, he needs free disk space not necessarily to install on the hd?
if he's running off livecd, and has downloaded the file, his virtual disk is about full, and in my expirence ubuntu livecd doesnt like dealing with large files
It really depends on ram, on my 512mb ram machine yes on a 2gb creature not necessarily ?
i am running w/ 4Gb ram, and i had trouble downloading winxp pro, unzipping it (1.4 ish GB between the zip and the iso
yes, I agree this is a lot of for 4gb of ram
my point is, that even with alot of ram, it can be filled up quickly if he's running off livecd trying to do it
has that program improved over half a year ago?
I mean kiba?
i dont know yet... lol still fighting
I compiled it about a half year ago, it takes a little effort but it didn't seem worth it.  I would give you my deb or config file but I through the lot out it really wasn't worth it
s/through/threw excuse me
well i saw a video on youtube with beryl and kiba-dock installed, and it looked pretty slick
it looks slick. the problem is kiba dock is really easily controllable and so everything is flying this way and that most of the time
excuse me "not really controllable"
well ill see when i get done fighting, if i dont just fsck it first
then I wish you luck on the kiba build :)
i _think_ i just finished... lol
enjoy, but I think if you are like me you will soon get tired of the stuff flying around the screen :) but I hope you enjoy
well i like to play with the stuff, i may never use it again, but i like to expirment and learn, and if i like it, i may keep it...
linux that is what its about, experimentation
yeah thats what they said about acid too
